Diagnosis.
Stathmopoda flavescens
is similar to
S. callicarpicola Terada, 2012
and
S. gemmiconsuta
Terada, 2012
in appearance and male genitalia. It can be distinguished from
S. callicarpicola
in the female genitalia by the transitional region of the ductus bursae and the corpus bursae with about 60 spicules; in
S. callicarpicola
, the transitional region of the ductus bursae and the corpus bursae lacks spicules. It can be distinguished from
S. gemmiconsuta
in the male genitalia by the uncus obtuse at apex, and in the female genitalia by the signum with length half the median width of the corpus bursae, the appendix bursae originating from the posterior part of the corpus bursae and the transitional region of the corpus bursae and the appendix bursae without spicules; in
S. gemmiconsuta
, the uncus is straight at apex, and the signum is as wide as the corpus bursae, the ductus seminalis arises from one side of the corpus bursae and the transitional region of the corpus bursae and the appendix bursae has a few scattered spicules.

Description. Adult ( Fig. 25 ). Wingspan 11.0‒13.0 mm. Head with frons and vertex cream white; occiput shin- ing black. Labial palpus yellowish white on inner surface, yellowish brown on outer surface, second segment blackish brown in basal half on outer surface. Antenna yellowish brown, cream white on anterior margin of scape; flagellum with dark brown scales along anterior margin. Collar pale yellow, blackish brown in some individuals (collected from Kuankuoshui of Guizhou ). Thorax and tegula yellow; thorax with a blackish brown spot posterolaterally, with a blackish brown spot on posterior margin; tegula with scattered blackish brown scales in some individuals collected from Sichuan and Guizhou . Forewing yellow, with a dark brown streak along costal margin, with three dark brown fasciae: first fascia from base to basal 1/8; second fascia sub-trapezoidal, from between basal 1/4 and 1/3 of costal margin to between basal 1/4 and 3/7 of dorsal margin; third fascia sub-rhombic, obliquely inward, from between basal 5/8 and basal 7/10 of costal margin to between beyond middle and basal 2/3 of dorsal margin, second and third fasciae connected with costal streak anteriorly, linked by a dark brown streak along dorsal margin; apex with a dark brown streak; fringe brown, yellow around apex. Hindwing and fringe greyish brown. Legs yellow dorsally, yellowish white ventrally; foreleg with tibia blackish brown on outer surface, first and second tarsomeres of tarsus blackish brown; midleg with tibia bearing yellowish brown bristles at middle and apex, tarsus blackish brown at apex; hindleg with tibia with dense long yellowish brown bristles at basal 1/3, 2/3 and apex respectively, tarsus blackish brown at apices of basal three tarsomeres, with long yellowish brown bristles at apices of basal two tarsomeres. Abdomen dark brown on dorsal surface, yellowish brown on ventral surface.

Host plant.
Alnus sp.
( Betulaceae ) ( Sinev 1999 ).

Distribution. China ( Anhui , Chongqing , Fujian , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Hebei , Henan , Hubei , Hunan , Liaoning , Shanxi , Sichuan , Tianjin , Tibet , Yunnan , Zhejiang ); Japan ( Terada 2016: 37 ), Russia .
Notes. This species is newly recorded for China .
